intro: Jussiaea montevidensis, commonly known as the Montevidensian bladderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is a small herbaceous plant characterized by its erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, bilaterally symmetrical flowers with five petals, typically in shades of white or purple. It is native to South America, particularly Uruguay and southern Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Jussiaea montevidensis is known for its ability to tolerate wet conditions and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
